reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel late (around 9pm). We had reserved an executive suite room. Upon arrival, Sonya at the front desk upgraded us to a luxury suite. We were thrilled, but when we got up to the room, it was next to the elevator shaft, which was quite loud. So we called down to tell her we needed to downgrade back to the executive suite. Well, by that time, they must've given away our room (either that, or they never had it to begin with). We had to wait over an hour before another executive suite was ready. The new room had a Common view, but we were told the room was reserved for the next two nights, so we could only have it for one night.

My husband and I now stay at the Ritz whenever in Boston for either business or pleasure. While we have enjoyed both the Four Seasons and Langham in the past, the Ritz hotel and staff have made it impossible for us to stay anywhere else. While we certainly enjoy the contemporary and luxurious, but comfortable, feel of this hotel - it is Steadley at the front door, Kemal the front of the house manager, Gabe on the concierge floor and Tim with maintenance who have made this a home away from home. All have bent over backwards to develop a professional relationship with us - accommodating requests 'with pleasure'.
reviews.title: Always a Terrific Stay

reviews.text: While some of the room furnishings have become a bit worn, the rooms are very well kept and clean. The beds extremely comfortable, the sheets soft and extra pillows and blankets are provided in the closet. The Deluxe rooms are standard in size and the executive suites are apartment like with a separate living room and 1.5 bath. The large windows do open. The bathrooms luxurious with marble tiles/counter, separate shower and large deep tup. The towels are thick and soft. Note that we learned that the hotel will shortly be undergoing a soft renovation of all rooms and a full renovation of the lobby. This goes to show that the hotel is well aware of the need for new furnishings, the concierge desk is easily confused with the front desk, there is a lack of seating and the lobby offers a cold welcome.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: Although, as noted above, we have come to know the maintenance staff; that is not say that we are disappointed. Things go wrong, it's inevitable - it is how the 'wrong' is addressed. We have learned that Ritz staff are empowered to make decisions to resolve problems directly with the customer, ensuring that any problem can be addressed quickly and professionally. There appears to be little need for staff to haggle with management, those who work on the issue solve the problem directly (even financially). That's a great way of doing business.
reviews.title: Anything but "Common"

reviews.text: The concierge/club service is well worth the added expense if you plan to spend the day at / come back to the hotel. For example, we use the club room for doing business (wireless access included on floor 12), getting a cup of coffee and a bowl of oatmeal in the morning, lunch (it's an actual lunch in a bento box) and a glass of wine, cheese and desert after/before dinner - all without having to call, wait and sign for room service. It's the ease of having your own kitchen without the mess. Everything is ready, tasty and Gabe, the club concierge, is wonderful.

reviews.text: Room was on the 10th floor. Very nice room. Nothing over the top though. It was a decent sizewith very comfy beds and nice linens. Foyer of this room was very large, seems like wasted space. Bathroom very nice separate bath and glass shower. View was a roof, with a few small bushes planted there to offset the drab view.
reviews.title: Sad to see this hotel and area going down hill
Dont let the bed bugs bite
reviews.text: I rencently stayed at this hotel and everything in the room was very nice along with the service. So with that being said I must tell that I was attacked by bed bugs and had over 40 bites all over my body. Moral of this story is that it does not matter how nice the hotel, take the sheets and mattress cover off and check things out. You will see the bugs or blood spots if they are there and you will be happy you checked. Having these bites is not pleasant. If you are staying in New York or Boston the high end hotels are experiencing beg bug problems so beware! Mabe it is because they have feather top mattresses.

reviews.title: Souless hotel in a decaying area
reviews.text: Not up to Ritz Carlton standards at all. We checked in to be told our room wasn't ready (it was 4pm) and to come back in an hour. No offer to take luggage or provide a drink. The hotel restaurant has closed due to lack of interest, and thus all your meals are taken in a rather bland bar that has a snack menu. The food is distinctly average, and the service stretched. The rooms are not 5 star standard at all, and this jaded part of Boston seems to rub off on the people here - it's gloomy and depressing....

If you are a gym person, The Sports Club next door is amazing. The only thing is the location could be a bit better.
